about.title: BirdNET-Go
about.subtitle: A modern interface for real-time bird sound detection and classification
about.overviewText: BirdNET-Go is a Go-based implementation for real-time bird sound detection and classification, built upon the foundation of the BirdNET project. This application provides a user-friendly interface for continuous bird sound monitoring and analysis.
about.birdnetDescription: BirdNET-Go would not be possible without the groundbreaking work of the BirdNET project. The artificial intelligence model powering BirdNET-Go's detection capabilities is the result of the BirdNET project's innovative research and development.
about.developersText: The K. Lisa Yang Center for Conservation Bioacoustics at the Cornell Lab of Ornithology in collaboration with Chemnitz University of Technology:
about.contributorsText: BirdNET-Go has grown and improved thanks to the collaborative efforts of many individuals. Their contributions, ranging from code improvements to feature suggestions, have been invaluable in making this project better.
about.contributorsNote: Special thanks to these contributors for their valuable work on improving BirdNET-Go:
about.communityText: We would also like to extend our gratitude to all users who have contributed through:
about.birdnetPiDescription: Special thanks to Patrick McGuire for his inspiring work on BirdNET-Pi, which has influenced the development of BirdNET-Go. BirdNET-Pi demonstrates the potential of bird sound detection on embedded devices and has set a high standard for community-driven development.
about.labelTranslationsBy: Provided by Patrick Levin for the BirdNET-Pi project by Patrick McGuire
about.licenseText: Both the BirdNET AI model and BirdNET-Go are licensed under the
about.licenseDescription: This license allows others to remix, adapt, and build upon this work non-commercially, as long as appropriate credit is given and new creations are licensed under identical terms.
about.taxonomyDataIntro: BirdNET-Go includes embedded bird taxonomy data derived from the eBird/Clements Checklist, providing fast local genus and family lookups.
about.avicommonsDescription: BirdNET-Go uses curated bird images from Avicommons, a library of hand-picked, cropped, and oriented bird photos licensed under Creative Commons licenses.
about.githubStarPrompt: If you find BirdNET-Go valuable, please consider starring the project on GitHub. Stars help others discover this project and support its continued development.

birdnet.title: BirdNET Settings
birdnet.description: Configure BirdNET AI model specific settings

customClassifier.title: Custom BirdNET Classifier
customClassifier.description: Configure custom BirdNET model and label files for specialized detection

modelPath.label: Model Path (Requires restart to apply)
modelPath.helpText: Path to external BirdNET model file. Enter absolute or relative path to birdnet-go binary. Leave empty to use the default embedded model.

labelPath.label: Label Path (Requires restart to apply)
labelPath.helpText: Path to external model labels file, .zip or .txt file. Enter absolute or relative path to birdnet-go binary. Leave empty to use the default embedded labels.

dynamicThreshold.title: Dynamic Threshold
dynamicThreshold.description: Automatically adjust detection sensitivity based on prior observations

enable.label: Enable Dynamic Threshold (BirdNET-Go specific feature)
enable.helpText: Enables dynamic confidence threshold feature for more adaptive bird call detection.

trigger.label: Trigger Threshold
trigger.helpText: The confidence level at which the dynamic threshold is activated. If a bird call is detected with confidence over this value, the threshold for positive matches of that species will be lowered for subsequent calls.

minimum.label: Minimum Dynamic Threshold
minimum.helpText: The minimum value to which the dynamic threshold can be lowered. This ensures that the threshold does not drop below an unwanted level.

expireTime.label: Dynamic Threshold Expire Time (Hours)
expireTime.helpText: The number of hours during which the dynamic threshold adjustments remain valid. After this period, the dynamic threshold is reset.

falsePositiveFilter.title: False Positive Filter
falsePositiveFilter.description: Reduce false detections by requiring multiple confirmations across overlapping audio segments
falsePositiveFilter.hardwareNote: Strict and Maximum levels require higher overlap settings and more CPU resources. RPi 4 or better hardware is required for these levels.
falsePositiveFilter.overlapAdjusted: Overlap setting automatically adjusted to {overlap}s to meet filter requirements

rangeFilter.title: Range Filter
rangeFilter.description: Limit detection to species probable in your geographic region

stationLocation.label: Station Location
stationLocation.helpText: Station location, used for weather data and to limit bird species to those probable in the region.

latitude.label: Latitude
latitude.helpText: Station latitude, used for weather data and species range filtering.

longitude.label: Longitude
longitude.helpText: Station longitude, used for weather data and species range filtering.

model.label: Range Filter Model
model.helpText: BirdNET range filter model version: latest or legacy.

threshold.label: Threshold
threshold.helpText: Controls which species are included based on their occurrence probability for your location and time of year. Default (0.01) is recommended for most users. Higher values (0.05-0.3) include fewer species with higher occurrence probability. Very high values (0.5+) include only the most common species.

speciesCount.label: Current Species Count
speciesCount.helpText: Number of species included in range filter. Updates automatically when threshold, latitude, or longitude changes.

rangeFilter.csvDownloadFailed: Failed to download species list. Please try again.

modal.title: Range Filter Species
modal.noSpeciesFound: No species found with current settings

type.label: Select Database Type
type.helpText: Select the database type to use for storing detections.

sqlite.title: SQLite Configuration
sqlite.description: Configure the SQLite database file location
sqlite.note: SQLite is recommended database type for most users.

path.label: SQLite Database Path
path.helpText: SQLite database file path relative to the application directory

mysql.title: MySQL Configuration
mysql.description: Configure connection settings for MySQL database server

interface.title: Interface
interface.description: Configure language, display preferences, and dashboard limits

visualContent.title: Visual Content
visualContent.description: Configure bird images and spectrogram display options

locale.label: Display Language
locale.helpText: Select the language for the user interface

language.title: Language
language.description: Configure the display language for the user interface

locale.label: Interface Language
locale.helpText: Select the language for the user interface

dashboard.title: Dashboard Display
dashboard.description: Configure how detections are displayed on the dashboard

displaySettings.title: Display Settings
displaySettings.description: Configure general dashboard display options like species limits.

birdImages.title: Bird Images
birdImages.description: Configure bird species thumbnail images for detection lists.

spectrogramGeneration.title: Spectrogram Generation
spectrogramGeneration.description: Configure when and how audio spectrograms are generated for detections.

summaryLimit.label: Max Number of Species on Daily Summary Table
summaryLimit.helpText: Max number of species shown in the daily summary table (Value between 10 and 1000)

summary.label: Show Thumbnails on Daily Summary table
summary.helpText: Enable to show thumbnails of detected species on the daily summary table

recent.label: Show Thumbnails on Recent Detections list
recent.helpText: Enable to show thumbnails of detected species on the recent detections list

imageProvider.label: Image Provider
imageProvider.helpText: Select the preferred image provider for bird thumbnails

fallbackPolicy.label: Fallback Policy
fallbackPolicy.helpText: Select what happens when preferred provider fails to find an image

auto.label: Auto (Recommended)
auto.helpText: Spectrograms are generated automatically when detection is viewed on user interface. For long list of detections spectrogram generation may take a long time on systems with limited CPU resources.

prerender.label: Pre-render in Background
prerender.helpText: Generate spectrograms automatically during audio clip save. On resource constrained systems like Raspberry Pi Zero or 3 this provides more responsive user interface due to spectrograms being rendered in background, however this mode will consume more disk space as spectrograms are created for every detection.

userRequested.label: User-Requested Only
userRequested.helpText: Generate spectrograms only when you click the generate button. Perfect for resource-constrained systems (Raspberry Pi 3/Zero) - zero automatic overhead, you control when CPU is used.

style.label: Spectrogram Style
style.helpText: Choose the visual appearance of generated spectrograms.

descriptions.scientificDark: Grayscale with Dolph window, dark background
descriptions.highContrastDark: High color saturation with dark background
descriptions.scientific: Grayscale with Dolph window, light background (xeno-canto style)

dynamicRange.label: Dynamic Range
dynamicRange.helpText: Controls contrast - lower values make weak signals stand out better, higher values show more detail.

descriptions.highContrast: Best for weak signals. Bird calls stand out clearly from background noise. Recommended for scientific/grayscale styles.
descriptions.standard: Default balanced setting. Good for most use cases.
descriptions.extended: More detail visible but lower contrast. SoX default value.

enabled.label: Enable Spectrogram Pre-Rendering
enabled.helpText: DEPRECATED: Use Generation Mode instead. Generate spectrograms in the background when detections are saved to eliminate UI lag.

nodeName.label: Node Name
nodeName.helpText: Node name is used to identify source system in multi node setup, also used as identifier for MQTT messages.

sensitivity.label: Sensitivity
sensitivity.helpText: Detection sensitivity. Higher values result in higher sensitivity. Values in 0.5, 1.5.

overlap.label: Overlap
overlap.helpText: Overlap of prediction segments. Values in 0.0, 2.9.

locale.label: Locale
locale.helpText: Locale for translated species common names.

tensorflowThreads.label: TensorFlow CPU Threads
tensorflowThreads.helpText: Number of CPU threads. Set to 0 to use all available threads.

errors.localesLoadFailed: Unable to load language options. Using defaults.
errors.providersLoadFailed: Unable to load image providers. Using defaults.
errors.rangeFilterTestFailed: Failed to test range filter settings

telemetry.title: Error Tracking & Telemetry
telemetry.description: Optional error tracking to help improve BirdNET-Go reliability and performance

diagnostics.title: Support & Diagnostics
diagnostics.description: Help developers fix your issues faster by providing essential diagnostic information

privacyPoints.helpImprove: Telemetry data helps developers identify and fix issues in BirdNET-Go

systemId.label: Your System ID
systemId.description: Use this ID when reporting issues

description.intro: Support reports are **essential for troubleshooting** and dramatically improve our ability to resolve issues you're experiencing. They provide developers with crucial context about your system configuration, recent application logs, and error patterns that would be impossible to diagnose otherwise.

githubRequired.title: Required: GitHub Issue for Support Uploads
githubRequired.description: Support uploads require a GitHub issue number. Please create a GitHub issue describing your problem before generating a support report. Without a linked issue, developers cannot act on your support data.

githubIssue.label: GitHub Issue Number
githubIssue.helper: View existing issues or create a new issue first

whatsIncluded.title: What's included in the report:
whatsIncluded.applicationLogs: **Application logs** - Recent errors and debug information
whatsIncluded.configuration: **Configuration** - Your settings with sensitive data removed
whatsIncluded.systemInfo: **System information** - OS version, memory, and runtime details
whatsIncluded.notIncluded: **NOT included** - Audio files, bird detections, or personal data

userMessage.label: Describe the issue
userMessage.placeholder: Please describe the issue and include GitHub issue link if applicable (e.g., #123)
userMessage.githubTip: 💡 Tip: If you have a GitHub issue, please include the issue number (e.g., #123) and mention your System ID {systemId} in the GitHub issue to help developers link your support data.
userMessage.placeholderOptional: Provide any additional context about the issue that isn't in your GitHub issue
userMessage.systemIdNote: 💡 Tip: Your System ID {systemId} will be automatically included in the upload

uploadOption.label: Upload to developers (recommended)
uploadOption.labelWithRequirement: Upload to developers (requires GitHub issue number)

details.sentryUpload: Data is uploaded to [Sentry](https://sentry.io) cloud service
details.euDataCenter: Stored in EU data center (Frankfurt, Germany)
details.manualWarning: Uncheck only if you prefer to handle the support file manually

statusMessages.uploadSuccess: Support dump successfully uploaded to developers!
statusMessages.uploadSuccessWithId: Support dump successfully uploaded to developers! Reference ID: {dumpId}
statusMessages.githubIssueRequired: Please enter a GitHub issue number to upload support data

speciesCooldown.label: Species Cooldown

push.noProvidersDescription: Add a provider to start receiving push notifications

privacyFiltering.title: Privacy Filtering
privacyFiltering.description: Privacy filtering avoids saving audio clips when human vocals are detected
privacyFiltering.confidenceHelp: Set the confidence level for human voice detection, lower value makes filter more sensitive

falsePositivePrevention.title: False Positive Prevention
falsePositivePrevention.confidenceHelp: Set the confidence level for dog bark detection, lower value makes filter more sensitive
falsePositivePrevention.expireTimeHelp: Set how long to remember a detected dog bark
falsePositivePrevention.addDogBarkSpeciesHelp: Search and add species that might be confused with dog barks

errors.speciesLoadFailed: Failed to load species list. Please try again.

ffmpegWarning.title: FFmpeg not detected
ffmpegWarning.message: Please install FFmpeg to enable FLAC encoding support, BirdWeather is deprecating WAV uploads in favor of compressed FLAC audio files.

threshold.label: Upload Threshold
threshold.helpText: Minimum confidence threshold for uploading predictions to BirdWeather.

test.enabledRequired: BirdWeather must be enabled to test

retain.label: Retain Messages
retain.note: Recommended: Enable the retain flag to ensure MQTT sensors show values after Home Assistant restarts.

tls.title: TLS/SSL Security
tls.configNote:
TLS Configuration:
• Standard TLS: Leave certificates empty for public brokers
• Self-signed certificates: Provide CA Certificate
• Mutual TLS (mTLS): Provide all three certificates

homeAssistant.title: Home Assistant Auto-Discovery
homeAssistant.description: When enabled, BirdNET-Go automatically registers devices and sensors with Home Assistant through MQTT discovery protocol. Devices will appear in Home Assistant's device registry without manual YAML configuration.

discoveryPrefix.label: Discovery Prefix
discoveryPrefix.helpText: The MQTT topic prefix for Home Assistant discovery messages. Default is 'homeassistant'. Only change this if you've configured a custom discovery prefix in Home Assistant.

deviceName.label: Device Name
deviceName.helpText: The base name for devices as they appear in Home Assistant. Each audio source will have its own device linked to this main BirdNET-Go device.

homeAssistant.sensorsNote: Sensors Created: For each audio source, Home Assistant will receive: Last Species, Confidence, Scientific Name, and Sound Level (if enabled). The bridge device includes online/offline availability status.

discovery.success: Discovery messages sent to Home Assistant

test.enabledRequired: MQTT must be enabled to test

observability.title: Observability
observability.description: Monitor BirdNET-Go's performance and bird detection metrics through Prometheus-compatible endpoint

apiKey.label: Weather Underground API Key
apiKey.helpText: Enter your Weather Underground API key. Required for weather data.

stationId.label: Station ID
stationId.helpText: Your Weather Underground PWS station ID (e.g., KCAOAKLA12).

endpoint.label: API Endpoint
endpoint.helpText: Override the default Weather Underground API endpoint if needed. Defaults to https://api.weather.com/v2/pws/observations/current if left empty.

units.label: Units
units.helpText: Select units for temperature and wind speed (m = Metric, e = Imperial, h = UK Hybrid).

notes.none: No weather data will be retrieved.

yrno.description: Weather forecast data is provided by Yr.no, a joint service by the Norwegian Meteorological Institute (met.no) and the Norwegian Broadcasting Corporation (NRK).
yrno.freeService: Yr is a free weather data service. For more information, visit Yr.no.

notes.openweather: Use of OpenWeather requires an API key, sign up for a free API key at OpenWeather.
notes.wunderground: Requires a Weather Underground API key and a valid PWS station ID. See Weather Underground for details.

apiKey.label: API Key
apiKey.helpText: Your API key for the selected weather provider. Keep this secret!

temperatureUnit.label: Temperature Display Unit
temperatureUnit.helpText: Choose how temperatures are displayed throughout the application.

soundCard.title: No Sound Cards Detected
soundCard.description: No local audio input devices were found on this system. This is normal for container or headless server deployments.

hints.container: This is normal for container/headless deployments
hints.streams: Configure network streams in the Streams tab instead
hints.usb: Connect a USB microphone and refresh the list

streams.title: No Streams Configured
streams.description: Add RTSP or network audio streams from IP cameras, microphone servers, or other streaming sources.

hints.rtsp: Enter RTSP URLs in the format: rtsp://ip:port/stream
hints.multiple: You can add multiple streams for different locations
hints.protocol: Choose TCP for reliability or UDP for lower latency

soundCard.title: Sound Card
soundCard.audioSourceLabel: Audio Source (requires application restart to take effect)
soundCard.audioSourceHelp: Select the audio input device for bird sound detection. Changes require application restart to take effect.

empty.title: No Sound Cards Detected
empty.description: No local audio input devices were found on this system. This is normal for container or headless server deployments.
empty.hintStream: Configure network streams in the Streams tab
empty.hintUsb: Connect a USB microphone and refresh the list

noSources.description: BirdNET-Go needs an audio input to detect birds. Please configure at least one source in the Sound Card or Streams tab.

audioCapture.title: Sound Card Configuration
audioCapture.description: Select the audio input device for bird sound detection. Changes require application restart.
audioCapture.audioSourceLabel: Audio Source (requires application restart to take effect)
audioCapture.audioSourceHelp: Select the audio input device for bird sound detection. Changes require application restart to take effect.
audioCapture.rtspTransportHelp: TCP is more reliable but may have higher latency. UDP is faster but may experience packet loss on poor networks.
audioCapture.rtspUrlsHelp: Enter one or more RTSP stream URLs for network audio sources. Format: rtsp://ip:port/stream. Note: Authentication credentials should be configured separately in your RTSP server settings for security.
audioCapture.deviceSelected: Sound card selected and ready for capture

rtspStreams.title: RTSP Stream Configuration
rtspStreams.description: Configure network audio streams for remote audio capture via RTSP protocol.

streams.urlHelp: Enter RTSP URL with optional credentials (rtsp://user:password@host:port/path)
streams.healthLoadError: Failed to load stream health status

emptyState.title: No Streams Configured
emptyState.description: Add RTSP streams to capture audio from network cameras or other RTSP sources.

hints.rtsp: Use RTSP URLs from IP cameras (e.g., rtsp://192.168.1.100:554/stream)
hints.credentials: Include credentials in URL if required (rtsp://user:pass@host/stream)
hints.protocol: TCP is more reliable, UDP has lower latency

audioFilters.title: Audio Filters
audioFilters.enableEqualizerHelp: Apply frequency filtering to improve bird call detection by reducing unwanted noise and frequencies.
audioFilters.cutoffFrequencyHelp: Frequency at which the filter begins to attenuate signals. Bird calls typically range from 1-10 kHz.
audioFilters.qFactorHelp: Quality factor controls the sharpness of the filter. Lower values (0.1-1) create gentler slopes, higher values (1-10) create steeper cutoffs.
audioFilters.gainHelp: Amplification or attenuation level in decibels (dB).
audioFilters.attenuationHelp: Filter rolloff rate. Higher values provide steeper attenuation of filtered frequencies.
audioFilters.filterHelp: Add multiple filters to shape the frequency response for optimal bird detection in your environment.

soundLevelMonitoring.title: Sound Level Monitoring
soundLevelMonitoring.description: Monitor and report environmental sound levels
soundLevelMonitoring.enableHelp: Track ambient noise levels to understand your recording environment and correlate with bird activity patterns.
soundLevelMonitoring.intervalHelp: How often to measure and report sound levels. Lower values provide more granular data but use more resources. Minimum 5 seconds, recommended 60 seconds.
soundLevelMonitoring.dataOutputDescription: When enabled, sound level measurements are published via:

clipSettings.title: Clip Settings
clipSettings.description: Configure audio clip capture and processing for identified bird calls

clipRecording.title: Clip Recording
clipRecording.description: Configure when and how audio clips are captured for detected bird calls.
clipRecording.enableHelp: Save audio clips of detected bird calls for review, sharing, or building custom datasets.
clipRecording.lengthHelp: Duration of audio to capture for each detection (10-60 seconds). Longer clips provide more context but use more storage.
clipRecording.preCaptureHelp: Seconds of audio to include before the bird was detected (0-{max} seconds). Ensures the complete bird call is captured from its beginning.
clipRecording.gainHelp: Audio amplification for saved clips in decibels (0 to 20 dB). Makes saved audio clips louder for easier listening. Does not affect detection. 0 dB means no amplification.
clipRecording.normalizationHelp: Automatically adjust audio levels to EBU R128 broadcast standard for consistent playback volume across all clips.
clipRecording.targetLUFSHelp: Integrated loudness target in LUFS (Loudness Units relative to Full Scale). -23 LUFS is the EBU R128 broadcast standard. Range: -40 to -10 LUFS.
clipRecording.loudnessRangeHelp: Maximum variation in loudness within the clip (0-20 LU). Lower values create more consistent volume but may reduce dynamics.
clipRecording.truePeakHelp: Maximum true peak level to prevent digital clipping (-10 to 0 dBTP). -2 dBTP provides safe headroom for most playback systems.
clipRecording.normalizationNoteDescription: Audio normalization follows the EBU R128 broadcast standard, ensuring consistent playback levels across different devices and preventing clipping.
clipRecording.pathHelp: Directory where audio clips will be saved. Relative paths are from the application directory. Example: 'clips/' or '/var/audio/birds/'
clipRecording.typeHelp: Audio format for saved clips. WAV and FLAC are lossless (best quality, larger files). MP3, AAC, and Opus are lossy (smaller files, slight quality loss).
clipRecording.bitrateHelp: Audio compression bitrate for lossy formats. Range: {min}-{max} kbps. Higher values provide better quality but larger files.
clipRecording.losslessNote: Lossless formats preserve original audio quality without compression artifacts.
clipRecording.disabledInfo: Enable clip recording above to configure clip settings, file format, and storage options.

fileSettings.title: File Settings
fileSettings.description: Configure storage location and audio format for saved clips.
fileSettings.pathHelp: Directory where audio clips will be saved. Relative paths are from the application directory. Example: 'clips/' or '/var/audio/birds/'
fileSettings.typeHelp: Audio format for saved clips. WAV and FLAC are lossless (best quality, larger files). MP3, AAC, and Opus are lossy (smaller files, slight quality loss).
fileSettings.bitrateHelp: Audio compression bitrate for lossy formats. Range: {min}-{max} kbps. Higher values provide better quality but larger files.
fileSettings.losslessNote: Lossless formats preserve original audio quality without compression artifacts.

audioNormalization.title: Audio Normalization
audioNormalization.description: Adjust audio levels for consistent playback volume across all clips.
audioNormalization.enableHelp: Automatically adjust audio levels to EBU R128 broadcast standard for consistent playback volume across all clips.
audioNormalization.requiresRecording: Enable clip recording in the Recording tab to use audio normalization.
audioNormalization.targetLUFSHelp: Integrated loudness target in LUFS (Loudness Units relative to Full Scale). -23 LUFS is the EBU R128 broadcast standard. Range: -40 to -10 LUFS.
audioNormalization.loudnessRangeHelp: Maximum variation in loudness within the clip (0-20 LU). Lower values create more consistent volume but may reduce dynamics.
audioNormalization.truePeakHelp: Maximum true peak level to prevent digital clipping (-10 to 0 dBTP). -2 dBTP provides safe headroom for most playback systems.
audioNormalization.noteDescription: Audio normalization follows the EBU R128 broadcast standard, ensuring consistent playback levels across different devices and preventing clipping.

audioClipRetention.title: Audio Clip Retention
audioClipRetention.description: Configure automatic cleanup of saved audio clips
audioClipRetention.policyHelp: Choose how audio clips are automatically deleted. None: keep all clips. Age: delete clips older than specified. Usage: delete oldest clips when disk usage exceeds limit.
audioClipRetention.maxAgeHelp: Delete audio clips older than this duration. Format: number followed by unit (h=hours, d=days, w=weeks, m=months). Examples: '7d' for 7 days, '4w' for 4 weeks.
audioClipRetention.maxUsageHelp: Delete oldest clips when the audio directory uses more than this percentage of available disk space.
audioClipRetention.minClipsHelp: Always keep at least this many clips for each bird species, regardless of age or disk usage. Helps preserve rare recordings.
audioClipRetention.keepSpectrogramsHelp: Retain spectrogram images even when audio clips are deleted. Spectrograms use less space and provide visual reference.
audioClipRetention.noRetentionDescription: Audio clips will be kept indefinitely. Monitor disk usage to prevent storage issues.
audioClipRetention.ageRetentionDescription: Clips older than the specified age will be automatically deleted, while preserving the minimum number per species.
audioClipRetention.usageRetentionDescription: When disk usage exceeds the threshold, oldest clips will be deleted until usage is within limits.

errors.devicesLoadFailed: Failed to load audio devices. Please check system permissions.

security.baseUrlHelp: Complete external URL for reverse proxy setups. When set, this URL is used as-is for notifications and OAuth redirects, ignoring Host and AutoTLS settings.
security.baseUrlValidation: Please enter a valid URL starting with http:// or https:// and including a hostname
security.allowSubnetBypassLabel: Allow Access from Subnet to Bypass Authentication
security.allowedSubnetsHelp: Allowed network ranges to bypass the login (CIDR notation, comma-separated list)
security.subnetWarningText: Devices from these subnets will have unrestricted access. Only include trusted internal networks.
security.basicAuthDescription: Secure access with a simple password

autoTlsRequirements.title: AutoTLS Requirements:
autoTlsRequirements.domainRequired: A registered domain name is required
autoTlsRequirements.domainPointing: Domain must point to this server's public IP
autoTlsRequirements.portsAccessible: Ports 80 and 443 must be accessible from the internet

basicAuthentication.title: Basic Authentication
basicAuthentication.description: Secure access with a simple password
basicAuthentication.passwordHelpText: Limit access to settings with a password.

oauth.title: OAuth2 Social Authentication
oauth.description: Single sign-on to log in with your existing account

form.providerHelpText: Select the OAuth provider to configure

providers.title: Configured Providers
providers.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the {provider} OAuth provider?

oauth.noProvidersDescription: Add a provider to enable social login with Google, GitHub, Microsoft, LINE, or Kakao accounts.
oauth.clientIdHelpText: The OAuth 2.0 Client ID from your provider's developer console
oauth.clientSecretHelpText: The OAuth 2.0 Client Secret from your provider's developer console
oauth.userIdHelpText: Restrict access to a specific user account by email or ID

google.redirectUriTitle: Redirect URI for Google Cloud Console:
google.getCredentialsLabel: Get your credentials from Google Cloud Console
google.clientIdHelpText: The OAuth 2.0 Client ID obtained from Google Cloud Console when setting up OAuth credentials.
google.clientSecretHelpText: The OAuth 2.0 Client Secret obtained from Google Cloud Console when setting up OAuth credentials.

github.redirectUriTitle: Redirect URI for GitHub Developer Settings:
github.getCredentialsLabel: Get your credentials from GitHub Developer Settings
github.clientIdHelpText: The OAuth 2.0 Client ID obtained from GitHub Developer Settings when setting up OAuth credentials.
github.clientSecretHelpText: The OAuth 2.0 Client Secret obtained from GitHub Developer Settings when setting up OAuth credentials.

microsoft.title: Microsoft Account
microsoft.enableLabel: Allow OAuth2 Login via Microsoft Account
microsoft.redirectUriTitle: Redirect URI for Azure App Registration:
microsoft.getCredentialsLabel: Get your credentials from Azure Portal
microsoft.clientIdHelpText: The Application (client) ID obtained from Azure App Registration.
microsoft.clientSecretHelpText: The client secret value obtained from Azure App Registration.

line.title: LINE Login
line.redirectUriTitle: Redirect URI for LINE Developers Console:
line.getCredentialsLabel: Get your credentials from LINE Developers Console
line.clientIdHelpText: The Channel ID obtained from LINE Developers Console when setting up LINE Login.
line.clientSecretHelpText: The Channel Secret obtained from LINE Developers Console when setting up LINE Login.

kakao.title: Kakao Login
kakao.redirectUriTitle: Redirect URI for Kakao Developers Console:
kakao.getCredentialsLabel: Get your credentials from Kakao Developers Console
kakao.clientIdHelpText: The REST API Key obtained from Kakao Developers Console when setting up Kakao Login.
kakao.clientSecretHelpText: The Client Secret obtained from Kakao Developers Console when setting up Kakao Login.

bypassAuthentication.title: Bypass Authentication
bypassAuthentication.description: Allow access to settings without authentication

placeholders.allowedUsers: Enter one or more allowed user emails

activeSpecies.title: Active Species
activeSpecies.description: Species that will be detected based on your current location and filter settings

empty.title: No species found
empty.description: Configure your location in Main Settings to see available species

activeSpecies.infoNote: This list is based on your location and range filter threshold. Manually included species are always added.

errors.loadFailed: Failed to load active species list

locationNotConfigured.title: Location Not Configured
locationNotConfigured.description: Set your location in Main Settings to see species available in your area. The range filter uses your location to determine which species are likely to be found nearby.

alwaysInclude.title: Always Include Species
alwaysInclude.description: Species in this list will always be included in range of detected species
alwaysInclude.noSpeciesMessage: No species added to include list

alwaysExclude.title: Always Exclude Species
alwaysExclude.description: Species in this list will always be excluded from detection
alwaysExclude.noSpeciesMessage: No species added to exclude list

customConfiguration.title: Custom Species Configuration
customConfiguration.description: Species specific threshold values, detection intervals, and actions

helpText.threshold: Threshold: Minimum confidence score (0-1) required for detection
helpText.interval: Interval: Minimum time in seconds between detections of the same species (0 = use global default)
helpText.actions: Actions: Custom commands to execute when this species is detected

emptyState.title: No configurations yet.
emptyState.description: Click "Add Configuration" to customize species detection settings.

actionType.label: Action Type
actionType.onlySupported: Currently, only Execute Command actions are supported

command.label: Command
command.helpText: Provide the full path to the command or script you want to execute

parameters.label: Parameters
parameters.helpText: These values will be passed to your command in the order listed

executeDefaults.label: Also run default actions (database storage, notifications, etc.)
executeDefaults.helpText: When enabled, both your custom action and the system's default actions will run. When disabled, only your custom action will execute.

errors.speciesLoadFailed: Failed to load species list. Please try again.

tracking.title: Species Tracking
tracking.description: Configure tracking for new species detections based on time periods

enabled.label: Enable Species Tracking
enabled.helpText: When enabled, the system tracks new species detections and can send notifications

newSpeciesWindowDays.label: New Species Window (days)
newSpeciesWindowDays.helpText: Number of days a species is considered 'new' after first detection (1-365)

syncIntervalMinutes.label: Sync Interval (minutes)
syncIntervalMinutes.helpText: How often to synchronize tracking data with the database (1-1440)

notificationSuppressionHours.label: Notification Suppression (hours)
notificationSuppressionHours.helpText: Hours to suppress duplicate notifications for the same species (0-8760)

yearly.title: Yearly Tracking
yearly.description: Track first arrivals of species each year

enabled.label: Enable Yearly Tracking
enabled.helpText: Track and notify when a species is detected for the first time each year

resetDay.label: Reset Day
resetDay.helpText: Day of month when yearly tracking resets

windowDays.label: Window (days)
windowDays.helpText: Days to show 'new this year' indicator (1-365)

seasonal.title: Seasonal Tracking
seasonal.description: Track first arrivals of species each season

enabled.label: Enable Seasonal Tracking
enabled.helpText: Track and notify when a species is detected for the first time each season

windowDays.label: Window (days)
windowDays.helpText: Days to show 'new this season' indicator (1-365)

seasons.title: Season Definitions
seasons.description: Define when each season starts. Seasons are automatically adjusted based on your location's hemisphere.
seasons.hemisphereNote: Season dates are automatically configured based on your latitude. Northern hemisphere uses standard seasons, southern hemisphere has shifted dates, and equatorial regions use wet/dry seasons.

dynamicThreshold.title: Learned Thresholds
dynamicThreshold.description: This page shows Dynamic Threshold runtime data. When enabled in Main Settings → Detection, thresholds are automatically adjusted by multiple high-confidence detections. Species shown here are assumed to exist at this location.
dynamicThreshold.note: High-confidence detections confirm which species exist at this location. After multiple high confidence matches, the detection threshold is safely lowered to capture more calls without significant false positive risk. Thresholds automatically reset after the configured validity period.

empty.title: No learned thresholds
empty.description: High-confidence detections will automatically create learned thresholds for species

resetAllConfirm.title: Reset All Thresholds
resetAllConfirm.message: This will reset all {count} learned thresholds. Species will need to be detected with high confidence again to lower their thresholds.

errors.tooManyAttempts: Too many login attempts. Please try again later.
errors.serverError: Server error occurred. Please try again later.
errors.rateLimited: Too many attempts. Please wait {minutes} minutes before trying again.
errors.configurationError: Authentication configuration error. Please contact support.

errors.radioValueRequired: radioValue prop is required for radio inputs

errors.startAfterEnd: Start date cannot be after end date
errors.endBeforeStart: End date cannot be before start date

species.suggestionsAvailable: {count} species suggestions available. Use arrow keys to navigate.

feedback.endDateCleared: End date cleared to maintain valid range
feedback.startDateCleared: Start date cleared to maintain valid range
feedback.invalidDateFormat: Invalid date format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD format
feedback.dateOutOfRange: Selected date is outside allowed range

aria.dayUnavailable: Day {day} is not available for selection
